tit.e: Shihai monjo
Shihai monjo
Shihai monjo

sen.j: 紙背文書（しはいもんじょ）とは、和紙の使用済みの面を反故（ほご）として、その裏面を利用して別の文書（古文書）が書かれた場合に、先に書かれた面の文書のことをいう。
sen.e: Shihai monjo refers to monjo (a document) written on one side of washi (Japanese paper) before another monjo (an ancient document) was written on the other side of the used paper, which was regarded as a scrap paper.
Shihai monjo refers to the monjo (ancient document) written on washi (Japanese paper) before another monjo was then written on the other side of that same piece of paper.
sen.cmt: 全文を書き換えました。
sen.e: Shihai monjo refers to the monjo (ancient document) written on washi (Japanese paper) before another monjo was then written on the other side of that same piece of paper.

sen.j: 後で書かれた文書が主体となるので、先に書かれた文書が紙背（裏）となる。
sen.e: Because monjo written later was considered the main document, monjo written first became the document written on the back side of the paper.
Because the monjo written later was considered the main one, the one written first was regarded as being written on the back side of the paper.
sen.cmt: 全文を書き換えました。
sen.e: Because the monjo written later was considered the main one, the one written first was regarded as being written on the back side of the paper.

sen.j: 裏文書（うらもんじょ）ともいう。
sen.e: Shihai monjo is also called ura monjo.
Shihai monjo is also called ura monjo.
Shihai monjo is also called ura monjo.

tit.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 古くは和紙が貴重品であったために、使用済みの面を反故として、白紙の状態である裏面を利用して別の筆記を行っており、漉返紙と並んで和紙の再利用法として活用されていた。
sen.e: Since washi was a valuable item in ancient times, the used side of the paper was made into a scrap paper and the back side of the used paper, which was blank, was reused for other writings; this method for recycling washi was used for shihai monjo, as well as sukigaeshi gami (paper made from dissolved old paper).

Since washi (Japanese paper) was valuable in ancient times, once paper was used, the back side of the paper, which was blank, was reused for other writing; this method for recycling Japanese paper was utilized along with sukigaeshi gami (paper made by redissolving used paper).
sen.cmt: 全文を書き換えました。
sen.e: Since washi (Japanese paper) was valuable in ancient times, once paper was used, the back side of the paper, which was blank, was reused for other writing; this method for recycling Japanese paper was utilized along with sukigaeshi gami (paper made by redissolving used paper).

sen.j: また、奈良時代から具注暦の余白部分に日記を書く習慣が生まれたが、書ききれなかった部分を紙背に追記して記述した。
sen.e: In addition, writing a diary on the blank space of guchureki (annotated calendar) had been practiced since the Nara period and when more space was needed, the extra lines were added on the back side of the calendar.

In addition, writing a diary on the blank space of guchureki (annotated calendar) had been practiced since the Nara period and when more space was needed, extra lines were added on the back side of the calendar.
sen.cmt: extra lines の前の the を削除しました。
sen.e: In addition, writing a diary on the blank space of guchureki (annotated calendar) had been practiced since the Nara period and when more space was needed, extra lines were added on the back side of the calendar.

sen.j: 他に、後日、補筆・清書作業を行うことを考慮し、そのための参考内容を調達の容易な紙背を利用して執筆した文書などがある。
sen.e: Besides these, there are monjo composed of the references written on the back side of the paper which was easy to procure, to be used later for adding extra lines or making a fair copy.

Besides these, there are monjo composed of casual references written on the back side of used paper (which was relatively easy to procure), to be turned later into a fuller version with new parts or from which a fair copy could be made.
sen.cmt: 数か所修正および明確化しました。
sen.e: Besides these, there are monjo composed of casual references written on the back side of used paper (which was relatively easy to procure), to be turned later into a fuller version with new parts or from which a fair copy could be made.

sen.j: 万葉仮名、仮名消息など、かなの発達史上、重要な紙背文書が多くある。
sen.e: There are many important shihai monjo in the history of development of kana (syllabic Japanese scripts) related to manyo-gana (an ancient form of Japanese kana using Chinese characters to represent Japanese sounds) and kanashosoku (a letter written in kana).

There are many important shihai monjo in the history of the development of kana (syllabic Japanese scripts) related to manyo-gana (an ancient form of Japanese kana using Chinese characters to represent Japanese sounds) and kanashosoku (a letter written in kana).
sen.cmt: development の前に the を追記しました。
sen.e: There are many important shihai monjo in the history of the development of kana (syllabic Japanese scripts) related to manyo-gana (an ancient form of Japanese kana using Chinese characters to represent Japanese sounds) and kanashosoku (a letter written in kana).

tit.e: Main shihai monjo
Main shihai monjo
Main shihai monjo
Shosoin monjo
Shosoin monjo
Shosoin monjo

sen.j: 正倉院の中倉に納められている文書を正倉院文書という。
sen.e: Monjo kept in the middle section of the Shosoin (the treasure house) are called shosoin monjo.
Documents kept in the middle section of the Shosoin (the Treasure House) are called shosoin monjo.
sen.cmt: Monjo を Documents に、the treasure house を the Treasure House に修正しました。
sen.e: Documents kept in the middle section of the Shosoin (the Treasure House) are called shosoin monjo.

sen.j: 戸籍などの律令制の公文書が反故として東大寺に渡り、その紙背を東大寺は記録紙などに利用した。
sen.e: After koseki (Japanese family registry) and other official documents under the ritsuryo system (the historical law system based on the philosophies of Confucianism and Chinese Legalism in Japan) ended up at the Todai-ji Temple as scrap papers, the back side of those papers was used as a recording paper.

After koseki (Japanese family registry) and other official documents under the ritsuryo system (the historical law system based on the philosophies of Confucianism and Chinese Legalism in Japan) ended up at Todai-ji Temple as scrap paper, the back side of that paper was used for creating records.
sen.cmt: Todai-ji Temple の前の the を削除しました。papers を paper に修正しました。（paper は不加算名詞です。）those papers was used as a recording paper を that paper was used for creating records に修正しました。
sen.e: After koseki (Japanese family registry) and other official documents under the ritsuryo system (the historical law system based on the philosophies of Confucianism and Chinese Legalism in Japan) ended up at Todai-ji Temple as scrap paper, the back side of that paper was used for creating records.

sen.j: 『装潢手実』、『正倉院万葉仮名文書』など数多くの紙背文書がある。
sen.e: There are many types of shihai monjo including "Sokoshujitsu (voucher issued by a bookbinder)" and "Shosoin manyo-gana monjo (two sets of monjo exclusively written in manyo-gana stored in the Shosoin Treasure House)."

There are many types of shihai monjo including "Sokoshujitsu" (voucher issued by a bookbinder) and "Shosoin Manyo-gana Monjo" (two sets of monjo exclusively written in manyo-gana stored in the Shosoin Treasure House).
sen.cmt: 括弧をクォーテーションマークの外に出しました。タイトル内の各単語の頭文字を大文字に修正しました。
sen.e: There are many types of shihai monjo including "Sokoshujitsu" (voucher issued by a bookbinder) and "Shosoin Manyo-gana Monjo" (two sets of monjo exclusively written in manyo-gana stored in the Shosoin Treasure House).

Letters
Letters
Letters

sen.j: 千葉氏が用いた行政文書を、千葉氏の家臣富木常忍が日蓮に譲り、日蓮が弟子檀那への手紙などに使った。
sen.e: Gyosei monjo (an administrative written material) used by the Chiba clan was given to Nichiren by Tsunenobu TOKI, a vassal of the Chiba clan, and Nichiren used this paper to write a letter to his disciples and patrons of the temple.

Nichiren used the back side of Gyosei monjo (administrative written materials) which were used by the Chiba clan and given to Nichiren by Tsunenobu TOKI, a vassal of the Chiba clan, to write letters to his disciples and patrons of the temple.
sen.cmt: 全文を書き換えました。
sen.e: Nichiren used the back side of Gyosei monjo (administrative written materials) which were used by the Chiba clan and given to Nichiren by Tsunenobu TOKI, a vassal of the Chiba clan, to write letters to his disciples and patrons of the temple.

sen.j: 中山法華経寺などに所蔵されている。
